answers.author: George Pettit
answers.text:
In the Phoenix metro area, and specifically in Gilbert, there is an experiment with adding the subdivision name on the street name sign to aide with neighborhood identity in the original townsite area as well as other older, special areas of the community.  Newer subdivisions (after 1985) have their own monument signage, and some have a style of street name sign as well.  The Heritage District experiment has shown that the standard metal name plate signs get really crowded and somewhat illegible at street speed limits, and it is somewhat impractical to build monument signs for these smaller areas of town.
